subclassFeature.name: Great Fool Patron
entries: {@i Laugh in the Face of Danger with Foolish Antics}

What horrors and sorrows can't be remedied by maniacal laughter? Warlocks that have made a pact with the Great Fool draw their enigmatic power from a powerful, otherworldly being of jolly revelry, whose twisted sense of humor is lost on mortal understanding. They are a mocking mirror to bring low the arrogant and mighty, though the Great Fool's ultimate designs are often nonsensical and incomprehensible.

Many Warlocks of the Great Fool adopt a signature aesthetic and performance style that best represents their folly. The Foolish Personas table offers archetypes of fools with suggestions for corresponding outfits and routines.

entries.caption: Foolish Personas
rows: {@b The Harlequin.} An elegant outfit of diamond motley with a painted mask—performs dances, gives eloquent speeches, and plays tricks
{@b The Jester.} A two-toned, checkered motley outfit with cap and bells—favors feats of acrobatics, tumbling, and juggling
{@b The Joker.} A vibrant, colorful suit with wild hair and bowler hat—favors silly jokes, slapstick comedy, and clumsy self-deprecation
{@b The Mime.} A striped, black-and-white shirt with a flat cap and red suspenders—pantomimes comical scenarios without speaking
{@b The Sad Clown.} A monochromatic, one-piece outfit with pointed hat and puffball buttons—utilizes melodramatic melancholy and song
{@b The Tramp.} A patch-covered coat, tattered scarf, scuffed shoes, and cigar—leverages sardonic wit, insults, and mocking observations

subclassFeature.name: Great Fool Spells
entries: The magic of your patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Great Fool Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Great Fool Spells
rows: {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB}, {@spell Rope Trick|XPHB}, {@spell Spiritual Weapon|XPHB}, {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB}
{@spell Blink|XPHB}, {@spell Stinking Cloud|XPHB}
{@spell Phantasmal Killer|XPHB}, {@spell Puppet Master|CrookedMoon24}
{@spell Bigby's Hand|XPHB}, {@spell Mislead|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Killing Joke
entries: You see the humor in everything—especially in the end of things. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you takes damage or fails a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} on that creature. You can use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Jester's Japes
entries: By calling down an aspect of the Great Fool, you can curse your foes. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you target a creature you can see within 60 feet of you and force it to succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer one of the following curses (your choice).

entries.name: Flower Spurt
entries: You spray a strange liquid at the creature's eyes, giving it the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Clown Shoes
entries: The creature's feet or similar appendages grow to awkwardly exaggerated proportions. The creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and saving throws that rely on Dexterity.

entries.name: Honk Honk
entries: The creature emits sounds, such as honks, chimes, or squeaks, that are audible out to 100 feet with every movement, no matter how slight. The creature can't benefit from the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Jolly Arms
entries: Any weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} the creature attacks with, including natural weapons such as fangs and claws, takes on a comical appearance as if it were made of wood, stuffed cloth, or balloons. The target deals half damage with weapon attacks and Unarmed Strikes.
The curse lasts for 1 minute. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mocking Banter
entries: Your witty and insulting japes become biting to the point of needling your foes' very psyche. When a creature damages you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes Psychic damage equal to the triggering damage you took, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Send in the Clowns
entries: You can call upon the laughing, jeering spirits of the followers of the Great Fool to strike down your foes. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you summon three ghostly fools. The fools are translucent and intangible, and they resemble clowns, jesters, or similar entertainers. Make up to three melee spell attacks against creatures within 60 feet of you. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, or the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition (your choice). You can use your action on subsequent turns to repeat the attacks.

The fools remain for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or you die. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Horned King Patron
entries: {@i Live Deliciously with Bewitching Power}

Whether motivated by desperation or cunning, warlocks that have signed their name in the book of the Horned King have chosen to live deliciously in a pact sealed in blood and a corrupted soul. Bestowed the power of witchcraft by the beast that stalks the deepest woods and darkest hearts, they perfect ancient rituals and weave maledictions toward aims only they know. With each victim of their malign spells filled with rot, hate, and agony, they become more like their patron until they effortlessly wield his kingly might.
Warlocks of the Horned King prefer particular implements in working their magic. The Witchcraft Implements table offers options for your favored reagents.

entries.caption: Witchcraft Implements
rows: Candles made from tallow mixed with blood
Dried bundles of herbs or mushrooms
Skulls or long bones carved with glyphs
Crushed berries or roots mixed into a paste
Iron cauldron marked with symbols
Curved blade for offering animal sacrifices

subclassFeature.name: Horned King Spells
entries: The magic of your patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Horned King Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Horned King Spells
rows: {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB}, {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Spike Growth|XPHB}, {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}
{@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB}, {@spell Fly|XPHB}
{@spell Phantasmal Killer|XPHB}, {@spell Polymorph|XPHB}
{@spell Dominate Person|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Witch Mark
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can imbue magic into a nonmagical Tiny object you're holding. Choose one of your prepared Warlock spells that has a casting time of an action. A creature holding the marked object can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast the spell (using your Charisma modifier, spell attack bonus, or spell save DC). The mark fades when the spell is cast from it or when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Malediction
entries: You can call upon the Horned King's malice to manipulate luck and fate. As a Magic action, you can curse a creature you can see within 60 feet of you until the end of its next turn. Alternatively, when a creature within range targets you with an attack roll or a spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to curse the creature with your choice of one of the curses below. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Agony
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack roll or Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} (your choice).

entries.name: Hate
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw (your choice).

entries.name: Rot
entries: The next time the target takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage, and it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Spiteful Curse
entries: When you use Malediction, you can now cast {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} once without a spell slot as the action or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} for that feature, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If the target succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, your use of this feature isn't expended.

When you cast the spell in this way, its range becomes 60 feet, and it lasts 1 minute with no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required. If the target succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, choose one of the Malediction curses, and the target suffers that curse instead.

subclassFeature.name: Crown of Horns
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can manifest the majestic might of the Horned King for 1 minute. For the duration, a visible mark appears on you—such as a crown made of horns surmounting your head, or you grow great antlers—and you gain the benefits listed below. Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend a Pact Magic spell slot (no action required) to restore your use of it.

entries.name: Dark Heart
entries: Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage.

entries.name: King of All
entries: You radiate an aura of power in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that originates from you. When you activate this feature, and at the start of each of your turns, you can choose a creature you can see in the aura. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer one of the following effects of your choice until the start of your next turn:

items.name: Enticement
entries: The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Wickedness
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks.

items.name: Terror
entries: The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition and must move away from you by the safest route during its turn unless there is nowhere to move.

subclassFeature.name: Gather the Covern
entries: You can now share the Horned King's power with those you deem worthy. You perform a 1-hour ritual, which can be done during a rest, forming a bond with up to six willing creatures that must remain within 10 feet of you during the ritual. You can end the bond for any number of the creatures (no action required), and the bond ends when you die. The bond grants the following benefits.

entries.name: Witchcraft
entries: Choose one of the curses from your Malediction feature. The bonded creatures can now each use that {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} option once, and they regain the ability to do so when they finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fly By Night
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one of the bonded creatures. If you and the target are on the same plane of existence, you magically teleport to the nearest unoccupied space next to the creature. You can use this benefit once, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If your Crown of Horns feature is active when you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, the use isn't expended.

entries.name: Hand of the King
entries: While your Crown of Horns feature is active, the first time a bonded creature damages another creature during its turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Philosopher
entries: {@i Distill the Essence of Creation}

Philosophers have focused their study of wizardry on the fundamental nature of existence and reality. They seek the most quintessential truths of creation and manipulate those forces and substances through alchemical practice. Through understanding, deconstruction, and reconstruction, they master the natural energies of the world around them and alter it to their will.

Every Wizard who walks the steps of the Philosopher does so to solve some specific problem, even if only at first. The Philosophical Pursuits table offers challenges or goals that set you onto your study of alchemical magic.

entries.caption: Philosophical Pursuits
rows: Someone close to you is lost in time, the planes, or some other esoteric state of being. Unraveling the nature of reality is your path to finding them.
You suffered a debilitating ailment or injury and turned to the study of magic to deconstruct the impairment's nature and transmute it.
Your teacher was killed by a rival Philosopher, and you must learn all you can of that discipline to protect yourself and bring them to justice.
The rediscovered research of a missing mage unlocked the first secrets of your understanding but contains many more you can't yet decipher.
Wizardry provides a path to immense power, but you know an even greater state of being awaits your ascension.
You encountered a material with miraculous properties, and you can't rest until you discover the secret of its creation.
Your sibling's soul was separated from their body in a spell gone wrong, and you cannot forgive yourself until you make them whole.
You were a stage performer who wowed audiences with magical acts, and you seek the ultimate magic trick to become a legend.
You come from an impoverished hometown and wish to utilize the transmutation of metals to bring prosperity to your community.
In your pursuit to be closer to the gods, you have sought the secrets of creating new life forms in your own image.
You were raised to revere the four elements, and you hypothesized that mastering the stuff of existence will bring harmony to them all.
You had aspirations of joining the military and rising through the ranks, believing that the magic of reality can be used as a weapon of war.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Knowledge
entries: You gain a set of {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}. You have proficiency with it and can use it as an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB}. Additionally, you can use {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} instead of the normal tool to craft a magic item.

subclassFeature.name: Quintessence
entries: You have learned the fundamental process of dissolution. You know the {@spell Dissolution|CrookedMoon24} cantrip. A creature or object you reduce to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with the cantrip is destroyed. If the target was Small or larger, it dissolves into a measure (1 ounce) of crystalline powder called Quintessence. You can have a maximum amount of Quintessence equal to twice your Intelligence modifier  at one time (mimium of 2 measures). If you create more, the oldest measure vanishes. You can use Quintessence you are touching in the following ways.

entries.name: Material Component
entries: When you cast a spell, you can expend Quintessence to serve as the spell's Material components up to a value of 100 GP per Quintessence expended.

entries.name: Reagent
entries: When you scribe a spell into your spellbook, or when you use {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} to craft a magic item, you can expend Quintessence to serve as 50 GP worth of material for the task per Quintessence expended.

entries.name: Vitriolic Enhancement
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can expend 1 Quintessence as an additional Material component to change one damage type the spell deals to Force.

subclassFeature.name: Albedo
entries: You can purify your Quintessence to amplify your spells. When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can expend 1 Quintessence as a Material component to increase the level of the spell slot by 1, up to level 9. The maximum Quintessence you can expend in this way on a given spell is half of your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (rounded up).

subclassFeature.name: Citrinitas
entries: You can now manipulate Quintessence to create, not merely to purify. You always have the {@spell Creation|XPHB} and {@spell Fabricate|XPHB} spells prepared, and you can cast each spell once without expending a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you cast a spell using this feature, you can cast the spell as an action rather than its normal casting time. You can also cast the spells normally using spell slots of the appropriate level. Additionally, when you cast {@spell Creation|XPHB}, you can expend a number of Quintessence up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to multiply the spell's duration by 1 plus the amount expended.

subclassFeature.name: Rubedo
entries: The culmination of your great work, you can now distill your perfected knowledge of existence into a physical form. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can expend 10 Quintessence to create a philosopher's stone—a translucent red crystal. The stone is a Tiny magical object with AC 19, HP 20, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage except Force. If you create a second philosopher's stone, the first one vanishes. While you carry the stone, it grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Amplification
entries: When you cast a spell, you can expend up to 2 Quintessence as an additional Material component to increase your spell save DC for that spell by the same amount.

entries.name: Equivalent Exchange
entries: When you fail a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend 5 Quintessence to succeed on the save instead.

entries.name: Longevity
entries: You stop aging and don't suffer any effects from old age, including dying from it.

entries.name: Sympathy
entries: The stone counts as part of your body for the purpose of the {@spell Scrying|XPHB} spell and for spells that restore you to life if you die. The stone itself serves as the Material component for the spell (if any) and is destroyed when the spell is cast.

subclassFeature.name: Occultist
entries: {@i Seek Beyond the Stars for Forbidden Knowledge}

Wizardry urges the relentless pursuit of knowledge that pushes every boundary in search of greater power and understanding, but some boundaries are never meant to be crossed. Occultists care not for these limitations, peering behind cosmic veils, devouring forbidden secrets, and pushing their understanding of spellcraft until reality itself tears open. It is from the strange, alien realms that are revealed which they draw even greater power, shattering all limits no matter the eldritch consequences.

Every Wizard who walks the steps of the Occultist does so to solve some specific problem, even if only at first. The Philosophical Pursuits table offers challenges or goals that set you onto your study of alchemical magic.

entries.caption: Philosophical Pursuits
rows: Someone close to you is lost in time, the planes, or some other esoteric state of being. Unraveling the nature of reality is your path to finding them.
You suffered a debilitating ailment or injury and turned to the study of magic to deconstruct the impairment's nature and transmute it.
Your teacher was killed by a rival Occultist, and you must learn all you can of that discipline to protect yourself and bring them to justice.
The rediscovered research of a missing mage unlocked the first secrets of your understanding but contains many more you can't yet decipher.
Wizardry provides a path to immense power, but you know an even greater state of being awaits your ascension.
You encountered a material with miraculous properties, and you can't rest until you discover the secret of its creation.
Your sibling's soul was separated from their body in a spell gone wrong, and you cannot forgive yourself until you make them whole.
You were a stage performer who wowed audiences with magical acts, and you seek the ultimate magic trick to become a legend.
You come from an impoverished hometown and wish to utilize the transmutation of metals to bring prosperity to your community.
In your pursuit to be closer to the gods, you have sought the secrets of creating new life forms in your own image.
You were raised to revere the four elements, and you hypothesized that mastering the stuff of existence will bring harmony to them all.
You had aspirations of joining the military and rising through the ranks, believing that the magic of reality can be used as a weapon of war.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Knowledge
entries: In your study of proscribed power, you learn Deep Speech or another language of your choice.
In addition, choose a level 1 spell from the Warlock spell list. You always have it prepared. You can change your chosen spell when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Intrusion
entries: Your search into the forbidden reaches beyond the universe yields great power but comes at the risk of letting something from beyond intrude into your reality.

You have an Intrusion Die, which starts at a {@dice d6}, that can change as you use your features. The die can increase or decrease, along this progression of die sizes: {@dice d2}, {@dice d3}, {@dice d4}, {@dice d6}, {@dice d8}, {@dice d10}, {@dice d12}.
The size maximum for your Intrusion Die is its starting size, which increases by one step when you reach Wizard levels 5 ({@dice d8}), 11 ({@dice d10}), and 17 ({@dice d12}).
When you use a feature that risks Intrusion, roll your Intrusion Die. On a 2 or higher, no Intrusion occurs, and the Intrusion die reduces in size one step on the progression.
On a roll of 1, the Intrusion Die rises in size one step, and you roll on the Intrusion table to determine what happens as reality fractures. Intrusions use your spell save DC.

The Intrusion Die increases in size by one step (up to its starting size) when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and it resets to its starting size when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Additionally, you can focus alien potency into your spells. When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can risk Intrusion to choose one of the following.

entries.name: Overwhelming Mind
entries: One target of the spell has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the first saving throw made against it.

entries.name: Seeking Eye
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack roll you make for the spell.

entries.caption: Intrusion
rows: You feel a presence behind you that whispers incomprehensible things into your soul. Until the end of your next turn, you can only do one of the following on a turn: take an action, a Bonus Action, or move.

Space twists and melts in a 30-foot Emanation around you. Each creature (including you) in the area struggles against the warping of reality. An affected creature's Speed is halved until the end of your next turn.

The nearest other creature within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take Necrotic damage equal to two rolls of your Intrusion Die (at its starting size), and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.
Reality tears in your space until the end of your next turn. You and each creature that can see the tear must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition while the tear exists.

One of your arms warps into an alien appendage, such as a distorted version of an arm or a twisting tentacle, for 1 minute. You can make Unarmed Strikes with the limb using your spell attack bonus. Instead of the normal damage, roll a number of your Intrusion dice (at its starting size) equal to your Proficiency Bonus. The target takes Acid damage equal to the total rolled.
Alien landscapes overlay your vision, giving you the Blinded condition until the end of your next turn.
Unnatural thoughts disorient you, giving you the Incapacitated condition until the end of your next turn.
You experience an instant of terrible clarity. You take Psychic damage equal to two rolls of your Intrusion Die (at its starting size), and for 1 minute, your spell save DC is increased by 2.
You regain an expended spell slot of level 5 or lower (your choice), and you take Necrotic damage equal to twice the slot's level. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

When you cause this Intrusion and at the end of each of your turns for 1 minute, pulses in the fabric of space fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from you, giving you and each creature in it the Prone condition.
For 1 hour, you hear whispered, disembodied thoughts of hateful scorn directed at you. While you can hear the whispers, you have Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that rely on Wisdom.

An Aberration or a Fiend with a CR equal to your Wizard level or lower (GM's choice) appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. The GM decides the creature's attitude (Hostile/Indifferent/Friendly) and actions.

subclassFeature.name: Reality Tear
entries: Choose a spell of level 3 or lower from the Warlock spell list. You always have the spell prepared. You can change your chosen spell when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you cast the spell, you can risk Intrusion to remove the need to Concentrate on it, and the spell ends after 1 minute or its normal duration, whichever is shorter. Additionally, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to cast the spell once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Occult Presence
entries: When you cause an Intrusion, you can roll twice on the Intrusion table and choose which result to use, and you can negate the Intrusion by gaining 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. Additionally, you gain one of the benefits below, and you can change your chosen benefit when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to change your chosen benefit.

entries.name: Alien Consciousness
entries: You gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions, and you can't be possessed.

entries.name: Cosmic Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic and Psychic damage.

entries.name: Spatial Domination
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and can hover.

subclassFeature.name: Beyond Space
entries: The nature of distance and location is revealed for the lie that it is. You always have the {@spell Scrying|XPHB} spell prepared.
When you cast {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, you can risk Intrusion to choose one of the following.

entries.name: All Knowing
entries: Treat your connection to a target creature as if you have part of its body.

entries.name: All Seeing
entries: Cast the spell as an action instead of its normal casting time.

When you cast {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, during the spell's duration, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to teleport yourself, and any willing creatures within 10 feet of you, to unoccupied spaces you can see through the scrying sensor. Once you teleport in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Crimson Sorcery
entries: {@i Control the Vital Power of Your Lifeblood}

Crimson Sorcerers harness the ancient magic of blood and life essence. They twist and guide the flow of this quintessential energy as a hunger grows deep within them. They manipulate their power to infuse the vitality of others, or they can rip it away and steal it for themselves.

Crimson sorcery can be acquired in a variety of ways. Some with this power were born with it. Others were infused with it through a dark ritual or grim event. There are those who discover it through lost secrets.
Consult the Crimson Origins table for a possible origin of your power.

There are a variety of ways you might have received the ability to harness your Crimson Sorcery to manipulate vitality and life essence. The Crimson Origins table offers suggestions of where your power comes from.

entries.caption: Crimson Origins
rows: One of your parents was a vampire. Though you aren't one yourself, you inherited their hunger, and it drives your magic.
You studied blood rites at a monastery that infused your own blood with power.
You survived a vampire's bite, though it left you forever changed and awakened your sorcery.
Your family suffers under a generational curse that has reared its head with you, driving you to drain vital energy.
You studied the secrets of life and death, perhaps to save yourself or a loved one. In so doing, you unlocked the crimson power in your blood.
You died, and a cunning entity offered you a second chance at life. You accepted and awoke with crimson sorcery coursing through your veins.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Well
entries: You hold a reserve of vital energy called your Blood Well, which you can use to empower your magic and fuel other powers from this subclass. When you deal damage or restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, you can expend your Blood Well to add {@dice 1d8} to the total for one target.
You regain your expended Blood Well when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or when a creature takes 10 or more Necrotic damage from you at one time.

subclassFeature.name: Crimson Spells
entries: When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Crimson Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Crimson Spells
rows: {@spell Aid|XPHB}, {@spell Blood Bolt|CrookedMoon24}, {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Blood Sacrifice|CrookedMoon24}
{@spell Crimson Harvest|CrookedMoon24}, {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB}
{@spell Death Ward|XPHB}, {@spell Sacrificial Siphon|CrookedMoon24}
{@spell Field of Reaping|CrookedMoon24}, {@spell Mass Cure Wounds|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Pool of Blood
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend your Blood Well to magically dissolve into a pool of blood, along with everything you're wearing or carrying, for 1 hour. The transformation ends early if you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or if you choose to end it (no action required).
While you are a pool of blood, you use your game statistics with the following changes.

items: You gain Climb and Swim Speeds equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.
You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.
You can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks.
You can enter and occupy the space of another creature.
You can't drop, use, or otherwise interact with anything you were carrying or holding.
You can't talk, manipulate objects, attack, or cast spells.

subclassFeature.name: Scarlet Vigor
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. In addition, when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can expend your Blood Well to reduce your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Vital Siphoning
entries: You can feed on your own life essence to fuel your magic. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die and choose one of the following benefits.

entries.name: Blood Boil
entries: You regain the use of your Blood Well.

entries.name: Crimson Pulse
entries: Expend your Blood Well to make the next Metamagic option you use this turn cost no Sorcery Points.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Feast
entries: Your hunger for vital essence is unquenchable. As a Magic action, you can unleash tendrils of blood that lash any creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you. A target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If your Blood Well is already expended when you use this action, the targets have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw. If at least one creature takes damage from Sanguine Feast, you regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage roll.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.

entries.name: Variant: Bloodless Crimson Sorcerers
entries: If you're playing a character from a species that lacks blood in the traditional sense, you can still take the Crimson Sorcery subclass. The essence of Crimson Sorcery is lifeforce, or animating energy that approximates life.

item.name: Draught of the Red Hunger
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain a ravenous thirst for blood and gain the effect of the {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} spell (level 6 version, no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) for 1 minute. You can repeat the attack on subsequent turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} instead of a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
This liquid is a shimmering red deeper and more intense than natural blood.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can gain the effects of the {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) while you aren't in sunlight. You can also revert to your normal form as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.

item.name: Elixir of Fogwalking
entries: When you drink this potion, your breath billows out in clouds of fog. For the next 10 minutes, fog and smoke don't hinder your vision, you can cast {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} up to three times (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required), and you can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} up to three times as long as your teleportation begins or ends in an area of fog. This bottle has a base like cobblestone. The glass widens near the top before narrowing again into an iron cap, resembling a lantern. The liquid inside is a murky gray.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The potion's duration becomes 1 hour, and when you use this potion to cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, you also gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Haint Hooch
entries: When you drink from this glass jug, you become insubstantial for 1 minute. During this time, you can move through creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, taking {@damage 1d10} Force damage if you end your turn inside an object.
The potion is stored in jugs labeled "XxX," with a skeletal smile drawn on it. The ghastly, blue-green liquor within has an overpowering smell and harsh taste.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

item.name: Harvest Brew
entries: When you drink this potion, you are filled with good health and bounty, providing you with enough nourishment to sustain you for 1 day. For the next hour, when you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.
The potion's bottle is made from a hollowed-out gourd, and the thick, liquid inside is a deep orange that tastes of nutmeg and cardamom.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} you regain are equal to half your level rather than your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (minimum +2).

item.name: Jinxed Rum
entries: When you drink this brightly colored rum, your luck takes a strange turn for 1 hour. For the duration, when you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, roll {@dice 1d4}. On a 2-4, add the number to your roll. On a 1, roll an extra {@dice d20} and use the lowest roll for the test.
This potion is stored in a glass rum bottle marked with crossbones.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: Roll {@dice 1d6} instead of {@dice 1d4}.

item.name: Lilypad Tonic
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required), turning you into a Frog.
This potion is found in a clay jar shaped and painted like a large frog, with a cork stopper in its back.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The potion has six doses instead of one.

item.name: Nectar of the Green Man
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the Commune with {@skill Nature|XPHB} spell, but your experience is filled with terror and dread. You must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the next 8 hours, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks while you can see a forest. You automatically succeed on the save if you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.
This bottle is carved from wood, with a green, leafy face adorning its surface. The liquid is a deep green streaked with shades of umber.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: You can learn all five facts from Commune with {@skill Nature|XPHB}.

item.name: Nightwatcher Potion
entries: When you drink this potion, you have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} out to 120 feet for the next 24 hours. During that time, you don't need to sleep, and if you take a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can remain conscious throughout.
This clay bottle with a waxed stopper is painted with the head of a great horned owl, and the liquid within is midnight blue

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The duration increases to 72 hours.

item.name: Reaper's Revenge
entries: When you drink this potion, you are filled with intense and violent vigor, gaining {@dice 3d8} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. For 1 minute, when one of your enemies dies within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to regain {@dice 1d8} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
The base of this glass potion bottle is shaped like a skull, and the images of scythes run up its neck.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For 1 minute after drinking this potion, when you hit a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature with an attack roll and deal damage to it, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage.

item.name: Sight of Sin
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of a {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) for 10 minutes, and during that time, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks to discern hidden motives or deception.
This potion is stored in a round glass flask. An iron band wraps around the bottle, ornamented with a goat's skull.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, you also gain the effect of the {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} spell.

item.name: Silence of the Drowned
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Silence|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) as a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you for 10 minutes, and for the duration, squid tentacles emerge from your mouth.
This sculpted clay jar is painted in a deep blue and adorned with squid tentacles. Uncorking it reduces all noise in the area as if you are underwater, and the liquid within is a coppery blue-green.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, you can spit ink from your mouth as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. One creature within 30 feet of you makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target is immune to this property for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Tincture of Mourning
entries: When you drink this potion, you weep with inexpressible sorrow for 1 hour. During that time, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition, but your continued wailing prevents you from being silent. If you are {@condition Charmed|XPHB} when you drink the potion, the condition is suppressed for the duration. This glass bottle is topped with a small crypt angel carved from stone. The fluid within has the taste and consistency of tears and the colors of a rain cloud.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: Creatures within 10 feet of you that are {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you also gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Wytchwood Sap
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can coat one weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition with this sticky sap and choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. A creature that takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition takes an extra {@damage 3d8} damage of the chosen type. Once applied, the sap retains its potency for 1 minute or until its damage is dealt, whichever comes first.
Wytchwood Sap is stored in small vessels made of bark with a wooden stopper that never fully contains this oozing, amber-hued tar.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: If you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, another creature of your choice within 30 feet of your target takes {@damage 2d8} damage of the same type.

feat.name: Altered
entries: You have been changed through magic, science, or a volatile blend of the two. You have a blatant physical augmentation of your choice from the options below. The augmentation is obvious—such as with stitches, grafts of other creature's body parts, or implants—unless disguised.

entries.name: Aquatic Adaptation
entries: You have gills or mucus membranes that allow you to breathe water, and you have webbed extremities that grant you a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have scales, plates, or thick hide that grants you an AC of 13 + your Dexterity or Constitution modifier (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You have claws, fangs, horns, or some other natural weapon that you can use to make Unarmed Strikes that deal {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit. The damage is Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing as appropriate to the form.

entries.name: Night Vision
entries: You have {@spell Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@spell Darkvision|XPHB}, its range increases by 30 feet.

feat.name: Charm Twister
entries: You know hedge remedies and hexes passed down through Old Ways teachings, and you can impart them into small wicker charms you weave. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Old Blessing
entries: You can cast the {@spell Bless|XPHB} spell once using this benefit, targeting only creatures carrying a wicker charm you've woven, and you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have. Your spellcasting ability for casting the spell in this way is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Twisted Hex
entries: As a Magic action, you can weave spite into a wicker charm you touch. Choose an ability. When another creature is carrying the charm, or while this charm is within an area that the creature considers home, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and attack rolls using the chosen ability. When the creature fails one of these rolls, it can make a Charisma saving throw, destroying the charm on a success (DC = 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and the ability modifier you chose for Old Blessing). You can only have one Twisted Hex charm at a time. If you make a new one, the previous one loses its magic.

feat.name: Crimson Ritualist
entries: Your study of blood magic and life force has borne fruit, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Blood Lash
entries: You learn the {@spell Blood Bolt|CrookedMoon24} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Bottled Life
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can perform a 1-minute ritual to transfer some of your life essence into a vessel for later use. Expend a number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} up to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and bleed into a vial of water or other liquid. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can drink the vial to roll the Hit Dice you expended. The creature regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total rolled plus its Constitution modifier. The vial remains potent until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Cult Initiate
entries: Your cult instructs you in eldritch rites, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Warlock spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the Warlock spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the spells you chose for this feat with a different spell of the same level from the Warlock spell list.

feat.name: Dread Speech
entries: You have articulated a few words of forbidden truth that resonate with—and fray—the fabric of creation, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Eldritch Word
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can speak a magical word aloud to force a creature within 60 feet of yourself to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier; choose the ability when you select this feat). On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. You can use this benefit safely once, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can use it again before resting, but you take {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

entries.name: Shred Fate
entries: Your dread secrets can unravel the destiny of your foes. You always have the {@spell Bane|XPHB} spell prepared, and your spellcasting ability for it is the ability you chose for Eldritch Word. You can cast it once without Material components or a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

feat.name: Fate Gambler
entries: Coming out ahead, whether in games of chance or in life-or-death contention, fills you with resolve and vigor. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bet Big
entries: If you don't already have it, you gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} whenever you succeed on an ability check made against another creature, when you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or when a creature fails a saving throw you forced it to make. If, in any of these cases, the creature has a CR of 0 or lacks a CR (such as another player character), you don't gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Win Big
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend your {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level.

feat.name: Ghostlight Medium
entries: You formed a mystical connection to the Ghostlight Express that affords you insight into the nature of spirits, granting the following benefits.

entries.name: Ghostly Touch
entries: When you damage a creature with the Incorporeal Movement trait, you can ignore the creature's damage Resistances, if any.

entries.name: Spirit Sense
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can sense any Undead within 60 feet of you, or any creatures in the Ethereal Plane that overlaps that area. You learn the distance and direction to any creatures you detect (or an Ethereal creature's equivalent position on your plane). Once you detect a creature with this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Grave Keeper
entries: Studying funeral rites and tending the dead's rest has made you a conduit between the worlds of the living and the dead. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Divine Channel
entries: You gain one use of the Channel Divinity feature from the Cleric class, and you can create the Turn Undead effect with it. If you already have Channel Divinity, you add this use to the feature from one class of your choice. Your save DC for this benefit is 8 plus your Wisdom modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Last Rites
entries: You can enact a 10-minute ritual to prepare the corpse of a Medium or smaller creature, expending at least 10 GP worth of incense, oils, linen wraps, or similar trappings. The prepared corpse can't become Undead.

feat.name: Hunter of Hunters
entries: You are adept at hunting monstrous prey, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Dead Aim
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can scrutinize a creature to spot its vulnerable points. The next time you deal damage to the creature before the start of your next turn, you ignore the creature's damage Resistances, if any.

entries.name: Studied Quarry
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made to recall information about a creature.

feat.name: Memory Starved
entries: Your mind ravenously gathers details and desperately clings to its memories and faculties, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Desperate Detail
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) checks.

entries.name: Iron Mind
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition and to avoid having your memories read or altered.

feat.name: Reveling Fool
entries: You joined a troupe of madcap revelers and learned to take on the guise of a fool, channeling otherworldly laughter and joviality. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fool's Mask
entries: By donning a jovial mask and a fool's, jester's, or clown's costume, you take on a new identity that hides your own. In the guise of the fool, you can get away with minor transgressions against people in positions of authority or station.

entries.name: Jester's Repartee
entries: You always have the {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} spell prepared, and your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose the ability when you select this feat). You can cast it once without Material components or a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

feat.name: Unreflected
entries: Your image is separated from you, making you unable to cast a reflection or a shadow, but you're able to easily slip notice. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries: Creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made against you.

entries.name: Unremarkable
entries: The loss of some part of yourself leaves you able to fade into the background. While you are within a group of at least two other creatures of your type and that there are no more than one size larger or smaller than you, you can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action from creatures outside that group by making a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check instead of Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}), with no need for being behind cover or {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. If you are ever more than 5 feet from at least two other such creatures while hiding this way, you are revealed.

feat.name: Death Defier
entries: When the hand of death reaches for your soul, you have found a way to reject its call. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cling to Life
entries: You add your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) to Death Saving Throws.

entries.name: Enduring Vitality
entries: If an effect would kill you outright without Death Saving Throws or would reduce you directly to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} without dealing damage, you are instead reduced to a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level. You can't use this benefit again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Swift Witchcraft
entries: You have honed your skills in the rituals of witchcraft and can quickly weave your magic in times of need. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Swift Invocation
entries: You can use an action to cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 minute. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

monster.name: Bat Hound
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Barred by Water
entries: The bat hound can't willingly move into running water or to a space up to 20 feet above running water. If it starts its turn in running water, it takes 10 Acid damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Glide
entries: If it doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and isn't wearing heavy armor, the bat hound can extend its membranous wings to move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends in the air.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bat hound can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) Piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, the bat hound regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 13}).

bonus.name: Outmaneuver
entries: The bat hound takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} and {@action Disengage|XPHB} actions, and until the end of the turn, needn't spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

reaction.name: Safe Descent
entries: {@actTrigger} The bat hound takes damage from a fall and isn't wearing heavy armor. {@actResponse} The bat hound extends its wings and reduces the fall's damage to 0.

trait.name: Spirits Susceptibility
entries: The elemental takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Force damage for every bottle of alcohol splashed onto it, and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two Hexed Slam attacks.

action.name: Hexed Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 10 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed until the start of the elemental's next turn. While cursed, the creature subtracts {@dice 1d4} from its attack rolls and saving throws.

action.name: Swamp Grasp {@recharge 5}
entries: Swamp water and plants roil around the elemental. {@actSave str} {@dc 16}, each creature on the ground in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the elemental. {@actSaveFail} 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, until the elemental has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or until the elemental dies. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to make a {@dc 16} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check, ending the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition on the target on a success.

monster.name: Boneflayer
languages: Sylvan; understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The boneflayer doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Thunderous Ward
entries: When the boneflayer hears a drum or gong, or takes Thunder damage, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boneflayer makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Slashing damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 14}) from both talons. While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

bonus.name: Swoop {@recharge 5}
entries: If the boneflayer has a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the boneflayer flies up to half its {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks and drops that creature.

monster.name: Boggleswarm
languages: understands Common but can only speak if the swarm has gathered at least one Humanoid tooth

trait.name: Mimicry (Only if the Swarm Can Speak)
entries: The swarm can speak in the voice of a creature whose tooth it has implanted (see the Bite action). Listeners must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check to discern the mimicry.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny weasel. The swarm can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Sweet Tooth
entries: If the swarm can see or smell sugar at the start of its turn, it must use all its movement to move closer to the sugar. If it reaches the sugar, the swarm has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn as it consumes the sugar, and this trait doesn't function again until the swarm finishes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two Bite attacks that must have different targets.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) Piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) Piercing damage if the swarm is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}. If the target is a creature that has teeth, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or lose one of its teeth. The swarm immediately implants the tooth into one of its mouths. A creature that has already lost a tooth to this attack automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Coven Magic
headerEntries: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: {@spell Augury|XPHB}, {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB}, {@spell Identify|XPHB}, {@spell Locate Object|XPHB}, {@spell Lucky Charm|CrookedMoon24} (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or {@spell Unseen Servant|XPHB}. The hag must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before using this trait to cast that spell again.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Scoured Filth
entries: The hag is burned by soapy water. Treat a bucket or flask of it splashed on the hag as a vial of Acid. If the hag is fully immersed in soapy water at the start of its turn, it takes 20 Acid damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The hag can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hag makes two Bite attacks or uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell Contagion|XPHB}. It can also use Warping Caress.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of the hag's next turn.

action.name: 1/Day Each:
entries: {@spell Insect Plague|XPHB} (level 8 version), Polymorph Warping Caress. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. Until the target's {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level is reduced to 0, its body is warped and twisted, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and saving throws that use Strength or Dexterity. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} If a Humanoid dies from this action, the hag can spend 2 days of work to shape its corpse into a {@creature Deepdreck|CrookedMoon24}, or it can combine it with the corpse of a horse to create a {@creature Fleshdobbin|CrookedMoon24}.

spell.name: Ancestral Communion
entries: You invoke the wisdom of your ancestors to gain insight into your trials. When you cast the spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the duration, you gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} if you don't already have it.

spell.name: Blood Bolt
entries: You hurl a twisting bolt of blood at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, and you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Blood Sacrifice

components.m: a drop of your own blood

entries: You sacrifice a portion of your life force to enhance your magical power. When you cast this spell, you take {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way. For the duration, when you cast a spell that deals damage, one target of the spell (your choice) takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the same type as the spell's normal damage type (your choice if there are multiple).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage you take and the extra damage your spells deal both increase by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Buried Alive
entries: You send your enemies to their graves even if they aren't dead yet. A creature that you can see within range that is standing on the ground must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the ground opens and swallows the target, burying it up to 10 feet deep. While buried, the target has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover}, has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} and {@condition Blinded|XPHB} conditions, and can't breathe. On a successful save, the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of its next turn. A buried creature can dig out of the grave by using its action to make a DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check. On a success, it digs 5 feet closer to the surface. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it reaches the surface. When the creature reaches the surface, it exits the ground with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
The target automatically succeeds on its saving throw if it's standing on any thickness of stone or metal, or at least 2 inches of wood.

spell.name: Call of the Wild

components.m: a bit of animal fur or hide

entries: You unleash a primal howl that calls lesser creatures to your command. Each Beast in a 100-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you when you cast the spell must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition, it can understand your commands, and it follows them on its next turn to the best of its ability. On your subsequent turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to issue a new command. On a successful save, a target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn, but you have no additional ability to command it. The howl is audible within 300 feet.

spell.name: Captivate Undead
entries: You usurp the negative energy animating an Undead creature that you can see within range, attempting to take control of it. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition (ignoring any {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that condition), and it is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} toward you. On a successful save, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes against you before the start of your next turn. If you or any of your allies damage the target or force it to make a saving throw, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Chorus of the Lost
entries: You summon the eerie song and wailing of lost souls from a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered there must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage, and it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for the duration. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage, and it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. A {@condition Frightened|XPHB} target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Chain of Conviction
entries: You hurl a spectral, barbed chain at a creature that you can see within range. The target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Force damage, is pulled up to 30 feet toward you, and is bound by the chain. While bound by the chain, the creature is tethered to you and can't move or teleport to a space more than 30 feet away from you, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls made against the creature.

On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. The bound target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success. If you are ever more than 30 feet away from the target, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Consuming Pyre
entries: You cause a creature that you can see within range to burst into consuming, relentless flames. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Fire damage and {@damage 2d8} Necrotic or Radiant damage (choose when you cast the spell), and the radiant flames linger. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

While the flames linger, the creature takes the damage again at the start of each of its turns. The target, or another creature within reach of the target, can take an action to allow the target to repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.
A creature killed by the damage from this spell is reduced to ash, along with any nonmagical equipment it is wearing or carrying.

spell.name: Creeping Rot
entries: You send tendrils of black and gray rot toward a target that you can see within range. Three tendrils then leap from that target to as many as three other targets of your choice, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub. In either case, each can be targeted by only one of the tendrils.

A target that is a creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d8} Necrotic damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for the duration. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A creature {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way takes {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. A {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.
A Plant creature automatically fails the initial save, and a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature simply withers and dies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: One additional tendril leaps from the first target to another target for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Crimson Harvest
entries: A wave of blood sweeps out from you in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature of your choice in the wave must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If you damage at least one Small or larger creature, one creature of your choice that you can see within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half the damage roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Crooked Ward
entries: You touch an immobile surface and mark a symbol that causes agony in twisted creatures. An {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, 30-foot- radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} springs out from the point you touch. Each Aberration, Fey, Fiend, Monstrosity, or Undead in the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and attack rolls. When an affected creature enters the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on this spell for longer if you cast it using a spell slot of level 4 (up to 1 hour) or 5 (up to 8 hours). If you use a level 6+ spell slot, the spell doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}, and the duration becomes 24 hours.

spell.name: Culling Sickle
entries: You create a ghostly sickle that lasts for the duration and can strike out at your foes. The sickle appears hovering in your space and moves with you. When you cast this spell and as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on each of your turns, you can direct it to fly at and strike a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Necrotic damage, and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half the damage dealt. After the sickle hits or misses, it returns to hover in your space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Cursed Cacophany
entries: You focus on a creature that you are familiar with that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for the duration. Once a target fails its saving throw against this spell, you can't target it with a ritual casting of the spell for 24 hours.

While cursed, the target hears haunting, discordant music and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@dice D20} Tests. The first time the target fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} during a turn, it repeats the save against this spell with neither {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} nor {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, ending the spell early on a success.

spell.name: Devil's Due

time.condition: which you take when another creature within range takes damage

entries: You absorb a measure of a creature's suffering and escaping vital essence. Expend and roll one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die. You regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
If the creature took damage from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, double the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} you regain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend one additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Dissolution
entries: You touch a creature or nonmagical object and break the target's substance down into its most fundamental components. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage, and its AC is reduced by 1 against the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Eye Burn

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range targets you with an attack

entries: You sting the eyes of a creature attacking you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (a creature with {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition succeeds automatically). On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of the turn. On a successful save, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the triggering attack roll. The target automatically succeeds on its saves against your subsequent casting of this spell for 24 hours.

spell.name: Field of Reaping

components.m: a dried corn husk or wheat hull

entries: You create a shadowy field that reaps escaping life force in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} originating from a point within range. A creature {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you in the field when it appears, or when it enters the field for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, is cursed until the end of its next turn. While cursed, the first time the creature takes damage during a turn, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, and a creature of your choice within the field that isn't cursed by it regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage taken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Ghastly Charge
entries: You call forth the spirits of long-dead knights, which charge forward from you in a 90-foot long, 20-foot wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}, and then vanish. Each creature of your choice in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 5d12} Necrotic damage, has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn, and must immediately use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, if available, to move as far from you as it can, using the safest route. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Harvest Moonglow
entries: You call upon the light of the harvest moon to illuminate a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within range. The area is bathed in silvery {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB}. Creatures and objects with the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition in the light become visible as translucent, shimmering images. When one of your allies is within the light, it can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to absorb some of the light and gain {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} increase by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Harrowing Ballad
entries: You inflict a mind-eroding song on a creature that you can see within range. If the creature has an Intelligence of 4 or higher, it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration.

While {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, the target is struck with a rapidly repeating ballad that only it can hear; it takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks and on Constitution saving throws made to maintain its {@status Concentration|XPHB}. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Hungering Blade
entries: You imbue a weapon you are holding, or your Unarmed Strikes, with ravenous negative energy.
