For the duration, when you hit a creature with an attack using the empowered weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} for the first time on a turn, the target takes Necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

spell.name: Intrusive Despair
entries: You curse a creature within range, filling its mind with creeping paranoia and despair. When the target takes the {@action Attack|XPHB} or {@action Magic|XPHB} action, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or waste its action. Once the target succeeds on three saving throws against this spell, the spell ends.

spell.name: Isolation
entries: One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its mind shrouded in the dread of total isolation. For the duration, all other creatures have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition toward the target, which the target can't see through—even with {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, {@sense Truesight|XPHB}, or magic such as the See Invisibility spell—and the target can't perceive other creatures with any of its other senses. The target moves around other creatures, or otherwise rationalizes not moving through spaces occupied by them (such as perceiving a door as closed or as a wall if another creature is standing in the way). The target still feels pain but can't identify the source of any injury caused by another creature. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

spell.name: Lucky Charm

components.m: a four-leaf clover and a shard of broken mirror

entries: You touch a Tiny, nonmagical object, infusing it with a portion of your own luck for the duration. While another creature carries the object, that creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@dice D20} Tests, and you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@dice D20} Tests.

spell.name: Martyr

m.text: a Dagger worth at least 1 CP

entries: You touch a dead creature that died within the last minute and transfer your life essence into it. The target returns to life with {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} total. You immediately drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} (which nothing can prevent) with two failed Death Saving Throws, and you must immediately make a Death {@variantrule Save|XPHB}. You can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or become {@variantrule Stable|XPHB} until after you make this save.

spell.name: Mirrored Agony

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you damages your ally

entries: The triggering creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes an amount of Psychic damage equal to the damage it dealt to your ally. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

spell.name: Mist of Mourning
entries: You summon a thin mist that saps joy and vigor in a  20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within range. Each creature in the mist when it appears, or when it moves into the mist for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be filled with deep melancholy until the end of its next turn. An affected creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls, and it subtracts {@dice 1d8} from all its damage rolls.

spell.name: Murder of Crows
entries: You summon and unleash a murder of deadly crows. Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} originating from you makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 5d6} Force damage and has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A {@condition Blinded|XPHB} creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect also ends if the creature regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The crows disperse and vanish after they strike.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Mysterious Presence
entries: You touch a willing creature and shroud its presence. Until the spell ends, other creatures must subtract {@dice 1d4} from any Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks made against the target.

spell.name: Puppet Master
entries: One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration.

Magical marionette strings attach to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} creature's limbs or body, and it must use its action on its turn to make a melee attack against a creature other than itself that you mentally choose, moving to reach the target if necessary. The target can act normally on its turn if you don't choose another creature, or if the creature isn't within the target's reach after it moves. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.
On your later turns, you must take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to maintain control of the target, or the spell ends.

spell.name: Sacrificial Siphon
entries: You touch another creature and lay a curse that drains the target's vitality and transfers it to you. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target must subtract {@dice 1d4} from its attack rolls and ability checks, and when the target takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. On a successful save, you gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, and the target must subtract {@dice 1d4} from its ability checks until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Sanctum of the Shepherd

m.text: adamantine or diamond powder worth 200+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You create a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of faint, shimmering light centered on a point within range. You and  a number of creatures of your choice up to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1 other creature) can absorb protective magic from the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. When any of the chosen creatures finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in the area, the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} vanishes, and those creatures gain a +1 bonus to AC for the remainder of the duration. Chosen creatures who don't finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} gain no benefit.

spell.name: Sanctum of the Flock

m.text: powdered silver worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You create a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of faint, shimmering light centered on a point within range. You and a number of creatures of your choice up to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1 other creature) can absorb empowering magic from the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. When any of the chosen creatures finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in the area, the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} vanishes, and those creatures gain {@dice 2d10} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, and for the remainder of the duration, they have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma checks that use one of their skill proficiencies. Chosen creatures who don't finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} gain no benefit.

spell.name: Sanguine Secrets

m.text: a drop of blood, which the spell consumes

entries: You draw knowledge through the power of blood about a creature you can see within range. You learn the target's species and creature type, its current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and any conditions affecting it. You also learn if it has any of the following, and, if so, what they are: {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB}, {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to damage  or conditions. Additionally, the next ability check or attack roll you make against the target before the end of your next turn has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

spell.name: Sacrlet Dawn
entries: Crimson light shines down in a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} centered on a point within range. Each creature in that area that isn't a Construct or Undead must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Constructs and Undead in the area regain {@dice 4d10} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the level of spell that can be dispelled increases by 1 for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Shadow Drain
entries: You siphon away the vitality and sense of self through the shadows of nearby creatures in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Whenever any other creature enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or starts its turn there, or when the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} enters a creature's space, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Summer Winds
entries: You unleash a blast of light and wind in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Your allies in the {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} regain {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Undead within the {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} that are {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage and healing increase by {@dice 2d6} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Unraveling Whisper
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range and whisper a frightful phrase that only the target can hear. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.
While {@condition Frightened|XPHB} in this way, the creature has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to your choice of Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Veil of the Reaper

components.m: a dried corn husk or wheat straw

entries: You wrap yourself in shadows that veil you between strikes. At the end of any turn in which you hit a creature with an attack roll, you gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Ancestral Communion
entries: You invoke the wisdom of your ancestors to gain insight into your trials. When you cast the spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the duration, you gain inspiration if you don't already have it.
